title: 2015 AFC U-19 Women's Championship
text:
The 2015 AFC U-19 Women's Championship was the 8th edition of the <a href="AFC%20U-19%20Women%27s%20Championship">AFC U-19 Women's Championship</a>, the biennial international youth <a href="association%20football">football</a> championship organised by the <a href="Asian%20Football%20Confederation">Asian Football Confederation</a> (AFC) for the women's under-19 national teams of Asia. The tournament was held in <a href="China">China</a> between 18–29 August 2015. A total of eight teams played in the tournament.
Same as previous editions, the tournament acted as the AFC qualifiers for the <a href="FIFA%20U-20%20Women%27s%20World%20Cup">FIFA U-20 Women's World Cup</a>. The top three teams of the tournament qualified for the <a href="2016%20FIFA%20U-20%20Women%27s%20World%20Cup">2016 FIFA U-20 Women's World Cup</a> in Papua New Guinea as the AFC representatives.
<a href="Japan%20women%27s%20national%20under-20%20football%20team">Japan</a> won their fourth title with a final victory over <a href="North%20Korea%20women%27s%20national%20under-20%20football%20team">North Korea</a> on penalties. Both finalists and third-placed <a href="South%20Korea%20women%27s%20national%20under-20%20football%20team">South Korea</a> qualified for the World Cup.
Qualification.
The draw for the qualifiers was held on 17 June 2014. Four teams qualified directly for the final tournament by their 2013 performance, while the other entrants competed in the qualifying stage for the remaining four spots.
Qualified teams.
The following eight teams qualified for the final tournament.
Venues.
<a href="Nanjing">Nanjing</a> hosted the tournament, with two venues: <a href="Jiangning%20Sports%20Center">Jiangning Sports Center</a> and <a href="Jiangsu%20Training%20Base%20Stadium">Jiangsu Training Base Stadium</a>.
Draw.
The draw for the final tournament was held on 13 May 2015 at the AFC House in <a href="Kuala%20Lumpur">Kuala Lumpur</a>. The eight teams were drawn into two groups of four teams. The teams were seeded according to their performance in the previous edition in <a href="2013%20AFC%20U-19%20Women%27s%20Championship">2013</a>.
Squads.
Players born between 1 January 1996 and 31 December 2000 were eligible to compete in the tournament. Each team can register a maximum of 23 players (minimum three of whom must be goalkeepers).
Group stage.
The top two teams of each group advanced to the semi-finals.

Knockout stage.
In the knockout stage, <a href="extra%20time%20%28association%20football%29">extra time</a> and <a href="penalty%20shoot-out%20%28association%20football%29">penalty shoot-out</a> were used to decide the winner if necessary.
Semi-finals.
Winners qualified for <a href="2016%20FIFA%20U-20%20Women%27s%20World%20Cup">2016 FIFA U-20 Women's World Cup</a>.
Third place match.
Winner qualified for <a href="2016%20FIFA%20U-20%20Women%27s%20World%20Cup">2016 FIFA U-20 Women's World Cup</a>.
